{{< fa brands square-js >}} **Javascript**

```{.js code-line-numbers="false"}
const listItems = document.querySelectorAll("li");

function toggleDone(e) {
  if (!e.target.className) {
    e.target.className = "done";
  } else {
    e.target.className = "";
  }
}

listItems.forEach((item) => {
  item.addEventListener("click", toggleDone);
});
```

## Quarto websites are *static*

There's no need for fancy web servers—<br>Quarto puts the whole rendered website in `_site/`

![](img/static-folder.png){fig-align="center"}

. . . 

**Your job is to put that `_site/` on a server.**

## Servers {.nostretch}

Web servers are computers that (1) store files and (2) show those files as websites to web browsers.

. . .

![](img/there-is-no-cloud.png){fig-align="center" width="45%"}

All computers on the internet have IP addresses

::: {style="text-align: center; font-size: 1.4em; margin: 2em 0;"}
